column4: Hi... does anyone know if Textmaker works on Linux (via Wine, not the native version)?
if you're asking about specific application compatibility in wine, check out #winehq and !appdb
You can use checkinstall (see !checkinstall), but that is only valid for your computer.
- thanks... want it on several PCs though
nope.
/me makes a note of that
see the private message from ubotu....
the realplayer codes are some of the restricted codecs you can install.
- managed to find acopy of the realplayer installer on a backup, will try that and see
good luck
I was, and was not aware of that. Noted.
- it worked :)
Yay
sudo touch /forcefsck and then reboot.
- how can I force a full check on a drive that isnt present at boot time? I dont think its ever been checked :)
If you unmount it, you can just do a regular fsck on it while the computer is running.
- Its a truecrypt volume... when I unmount it it ceases the be a device...
oh.  I'm not really sure how you would go about doing that.
- I got it to show as /dev/loop0... what fsck command would I use to do as full a check as possible (with progress bar if thats possible)?
It is.
They are cnames for each other
/ grawity - Thats makes it even more odd that irc.freenode.net wont accept the connection then...
